name: Holly M.
title: "I could sing songs about Gong!"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X: I enjoy using Gong because it is easy to use, and allows me to go back and review calls. At the end of each call it provides a brief summary I can use in order to create a recap email for my clients. It also identifies action items from my calls I can use in order to keep track of what all I need to do following a call! Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X: As far as downsides go, the only thing I don't like about Gong is how it speaks about me in third person. It will says "Holly made introductions" and sometimes I wish it used "I" to refer to me so that I can copy and paste into a recap email. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x: Gong has helped increase my productivity and save me time. I love being able to go to the call and seeing a recap of everything in one place. I also like that it provides transparency within our organization and allows me to go back and watch other people's calls for learning purposes. It has helped increase collaboration, and in the event that a client has to be transferred, it allows for a seamless transition where no detail is missed. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

name: Leonardo L.
title: "Excellent tool for reviewers"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X: I am impressed with the accuracy of Gong's voice-to-text transcription, which is at 95%. I also like the insights and reporting features, which can help me improve my sales skills. I haven't yet extracted any reports, but I understand that this is not yet possible. I would recommend that Gong provide e-handouts or digital training materials on how to extract reports to end users during the migration training. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
I think Gong's chat differentiator is a great feature, but it could be improved by adding the following:

- Color coding the responses of the participants in a long monologue. This would make it easier to see who is saying what, especially when the transcript auto-scrolls down. I think this is already a feature implemented but needs further improvement.

- Inserting the responses mid-monologue. This would make it easier to follow the conversation, especially when there are long pauses or interruptions.

I would be happy to provide more details about this feedback on my LinkedIn profile. Thank you for your time. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x: Root cause analysis boost. Previously, our internal tool does help in terms of simple transcription which by the way is 70-80% accurate. But when our client saw the value of Gong they rolled it out fast and got implemented for usage. We were offered multiple internal training sesssions which is good but if training materials, like infographics on quick usage tips are often handed down on top of townhall trainings, it would be a nice to have. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

name: Kristi F.
title: "Great for deal intelligence but serious decline in customer service & communication as of late"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X: Gong's forecasting and reporting truly simplifies what's going on within your business from a sales perspective. Their dashboard is much easier to read and collaborate in than any report in Salesforce. Gong gives both our sales reps and our sales leaders more immediate visibility into our sales pipeline and instantly helps find gaps, so you can manage deals more efficiently and effectively. Their CS team is quick to respond and support.I loved our CS rep and she's been incredibly helpful over the past 1.5 years we've had Gong. She's quick to alert me to new features we maybe aren't taking advantage of and is able to get me up to speed on quick 15-20 minute calls, as she knows how little time we have. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
Onboarding was a self-service model when we first onboarding and that took longer than expected due to time constraints. I would have liked more hand-holding as we started to stand this up. Pricing is high for smaller companies, making it a large chunk of your sales software budget.

The sales team will change your onboarding dates by 30+ days without notice and not uphold promises made during the sales negotiation process. 

Their growth is showing in their lack of service, changing of reps and lack of clear communication to customers. 

It's becoming more evident that smaller orgs aren't the priority for the Gong team. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x: Gong is simplifying deal management and forecasting and helping us identify, rep-by-rep, what is helping them win or making them lose deals. The easy-to-read reports and dashboards make it easy for even new reps to dig in and discover what they can do more/less of and it gives leadership easy visibility into what's happening, rep-by-rep. This is saving us time, helping us have more valuable 1:1 sales check-ins and, helps us turn good calls/content into client testimonials that our marketing team is using to drive more qualified inbound leads. The Gong library is also used to help train and scale new reps. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
headerline: "Great for deal intelligence but serious decline in customer service & communication as of late"

name: Ronak S.
title: "Feedback on Gong Integration and AI Integration"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
By allowing me to review the specifics of the call, this technology considerably helps me remember client encounters. When questions or concerns arise, the ability to look back to the talk after it is over may be quite beneficial.

Gong has also been essential in helping me improve my soft skills. The call's transcript gives me the chance to evaluate my communication style, pinpoint areas for development, and tweak how I conduct myself in the future. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
The recorder name "notetaker" cannot currently be concealed because we do not yet have interaction with WebEx. This improvement was something we had asked for when we first started working with Gong. Furthermore, I'd like to point out that Gong does not yet incorporate AI, which might greatly improve the caliber of our chats. The use of AI might offer ideas for better language and communication flow in today's technologically advanced environment.

When someone attends a Zoom conference, for instance, and asks us a standard question like "Hi, How are you?" In addition to the typical "I'm fine, thank you," an AI-integrated Gong may provide other options. This may provide our interactions more richness and personalization, eventually improving the consumer experience. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x:
From a Gong collaborative standpoint, Gong has streamlined teamwork and troubleshooting. Its search functionality allows me to easily locate teammates who may have dealt with similar issues before. This fosters knowledge-sharing and accelerates the problem-solving process.

Perhaps one of the most valuable aspects of Gong is the knowledge-sharing it facilitates. I can search for specific keywords to access past conversations and learn from the solutions implemented by other teams. This empowers me to apply proven strategies to my ongoing calls, effectively resolving issues for our customers. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
headerline: "Feedback on Gong Integration and AI Integration"

name: Jack B.
title: "Strong Conversational AI solution for call recording analysis"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X: Gong has an excellent customer success team that worked with us throughout the migration process. We moved from Chorus to Gong, and immediately saw higher adoption and utilization of the tool vis-a-vis our previous Chrous adoption/utilization. Gong functionality ensured immediate user acceptance, and delivered immediate value to our front line sales users and their managers. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
Gong's implementation team was very supportive and engaged. But they would have added even more value if they had walked us through all the decisions to be made at the very beginning of the project. There were some settings and configurations that we needed to ask for their support to set up. Also, the email and call recording sharing models are tied to profiles, but the basic sharing options are
1) All
2) Their Manager's Team
3) People who report to them
4) Their Own
5) Specific Teams (as in people who report to a manager & that manager)

There is no option to define teams other than a hierarchical construct, which includes the manager. Thsi did not work for us. To ensure reps could see other reps emails/calls, but not see ones that were manager only, we had to manually add every sales rep to the Specific Teams option - this is cumbersome and could have been avoided if Gong would have a capability to have a defined grouping based on profiles. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x: Ensure reps are coached about their conversational habits. Allow better understanding of Deal reality - challenging reps on their stage or qualification where the interactions or conversations don't seem to support that classification. Automating draft follow up emails & taking transcription/note-taking off the rep's hands. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
headerline: "Strong Conversational AI solution for call recording analysis"

name: Lewis B.
title: "An incredibly helpful tool that works almost seamlessly!"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
It's incredibly easy to use due to the plugin with our systems, and so you barely even notice that it is working in the background. It allows conversations and calls to flow so much more, as you know that everything is being recorded.
The transcripts are processed pretty quickly, and the email link you receive post-call is amazing - you are given a list of follow up tasks, and even given tips on how to improve. 
Wherever I go in my career, I hope Gong is used. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
These are minor points as my overall experience with Gong is fantastic. 
Sometimes the recommendations for improvement are not relevant, as context is not taken into consideration - for example a high talk ratio is a given during a demonstration or walkthrough. 
There are occasional errors in the transcript but compared to other AI transcript apps I have used, Gong is one of the best I have come across. 
Finally, sometimes topics are labelled incorrectly or not at all, but this is not a big issue for me. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

It also saves me time post-call by collating my follow up actions. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

name: Scott H.
title: "Fantastic product, superb implementation support, top-notch CS and tech support"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
The product is top-notch, miles ahead of the "other" product you use to, ahem, outreach.  Lots of reviews on the product itself, so I won't go on and on about that.

In terms of the implementation services we purchased from Salesloft, our assigned representative Marcus was top-notch.  There's literally nothing I can think of that could be improved - he was a kind human, very knowledgeable, patient, helpful and invested in our success and not just treating this implementation as just another "transaction."  Trust me, I know how rare that is and how "nothing could be improved" sounds - but it's true.

We had some major personnel changes in the middle of implementation, and he took it in stride, extended our implementation period to accommodate, etc.  Marcus is a true credit to your organization, and given how important first impressions are, that's a big deal.  

Office hours twice a day, every day - with high-end, very knowledgeable resources *instead of* the typical office hour people at other companies who constantly say "hmmm... I'm not sure, check with support" is truly incredible.  They dig in deep to your exact scenario, offer up best practices, etc. 
- it's a fantastic resource.

Written documentation and videos are terrific.  Haven't gone through any webinars or the "university" yet, but will do in the future - I'm sure they are great as well.

The one thing I'll add to what others have said all over the web is that the flaky Salesloft browser extension is disappointing.  But in the grand scheme of things, a 60-second uninstall/reinstall process is something our team will gladly live with given all of the other excellent things about the product.

Looking to a very long relationship with Salesloft. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X: Oops, mentioned it above, but the browser extension that stops working several times a week is pretty disappointing.  I really hope that will be addressed, because that's the only negative thing I can think of.  Actually, one more thing - wish we could map any fields from Salesforce to a Salesloft phone field, and use that in the dropdown for the Salesloft dialer.  For example, we have to map our switchboard field to "home phone" in Salesloft.  Very minor though. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x: Compared to another leading product, Salesloft has better outreach in general to our prospects, combined with a much more intuitive interface without things broken up in various areas, inability to customize things, inability to easily move people between sequences, etc.  (Again, the negatives are about the "other" product, not Salesloft.) Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
headerline: "Fantastic product, superb implementation support, top-notch CS and tech support"

name: Rafael F.
title: "Unkept Promises: Poor Integration and Performance"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X: Salesloft does have a good drip campaign module and has good deliverability of emails. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X: Aside from the overwhelming feeling that you are somehow in debt to the company, the training is confusing, wording of modules and functionalities overly complicated and perhaps most importantly, their integrations are sold as something that does not come close that what is needed for it to be considered something of value. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x: Unfortunately, Salesloft can't solve the problems it sets out to do. They have guaranteed seamless integrations with hubspot, and it doesn't work. I don't say this lightly. There is no one-to-one mapping; it creates more chaos than it solves because activity data isn't transferred, lead statuses don't coordinate, and phone calls aren't adequately recorded with the integration.  Moreover, the platform is unreliable; it can function well one day, slow down, lag and be unpredictable the other. For any customer using hubspot, especially those that want to scale their nurture sequencing, stay way from salesloft. Not only is the platform very far from an integration that works, they have let down numerous customers due to the same empty promises of a "flawless" integration. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

- the delay in emails being sent (as in you cannot move on to the next step of the cadence until the email has cleared which can sometimes take a good few minutes)
-if a client of ours has the same contact and multiple businesses, I have found in some instances you cannot create another profile, so you have to use the profile with the incorrect business name and alter the cadences appropriately

The forecast that each of my employees submit does not roll-up into my forecast accurately, nor does it mirror which category/stage they have listed each deal in their forecast in. I am having to take time to pull each of their reports individually (or I have been asking them to just send a screenshot upon submitting for ease of reference) and then go in and manually pull each deal into the correct category for each of my employees to make my teams' forecast accurate. Additionally, if I click on "roll-up" mode, it will show none of my staff has submitted a forecast when they have, and if I go and pull their report/forecast separately, it will show submitted. It could just be something in Kluster that is set up wrong, but I know our Revenue Ops team has inquired a few times and been told it's fixed, and we're still having this issue. name: Timon E.
title: "A Seamless Workflow Companion"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
WeFlow is an exceptional workflow companion that has significantly streamlined my daily tasks and boosted my productivity. From its intuitive interface to its powerful features, WeFlow has quickly become an essential tool in my digital arsenal.

One of the standout features of WeFlow is its effortless task management. The platform's clean and user-friendly design allows for easy task creation, organization, and tracking. I particularly appreciate the ability to categorize tasks, set due dates, and prioritize them. This has transformed the way I approach my workload, enabling me to stay on top of assignments without feeling overwhelmed.

Collaboration is a breeze with WeFlow. The seamless sharing and collaboration tools have simplified group projects and improved team efficiency. Real-time updates ensure everyone is on the same page, and the integration of comments and annotations makes feedback exchanges efficient and clear.

WeFlow's integration capabilities are truly remarkable. The platform effortlessly syncs with various applications I use daily, such as calendar tools, note-taking apps, and cloud storage services. This integration has saved me valuable time by centralizing all my information in one place, eliminating the need to switch between different platforms.

The customization options in WeFlow cater to individual preferences and working styles. Whether you prefer a minimalist layout or need an array of color-coded labels, WeFlow provides the flexibility to tailor the interface to your liking. This adaptability enhances the user experience and adds a personal touch to your workflow.

Moreover, WeFlow's robust analytics feature offers valuable insights into your productivity patterns. Tracking your progress, identifying bottlenecks, and recognizing your peak performance times have never been easier. These insights empower you to fine-tune your workflow and optimize your efficiency over time.

In conclusion, WeFlow is a game-changer for anyone seeking a polished, efficient, and versatile workflow companion. Its user-friendly design, collaborative prowess, seamless integrations, customization options, and insightful analytics combine to create a truly indispensable tool. WeFlow has not only enhanced my productivity but has also transformed how I approach my daily tasks. I wholeheartedly recommend WeFlow to professionals and individuals alike. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
While WeFlow offers an impressive array of features and benefits, there are a few areas that some users might find less appealing or could potentially be improved upon:

Learning Curve: For users who are new to task management and workflow tools, WeFlow's initial learning curve might feel a bit steep. The abundance of features and customization options could be overwhelming at first, leading to some confusion and requiring time to become fully accustomed to the platform.
Mobile App Experience: While WeFlow's web interface is robust and well-designed, the mobile app experience might be less polished in comparison. Some users have reported occasional glitches, slower performance, or a slightly less intuitive user interface on mobile devices.
Pricing Structure: WeFlow offers different pricing tiers with varying features, which is common among similar software. However, some users might find the pricing slightly higher compared to competing tools, especially if they require advanced features that are only available in higher-priced plans.
Limited Offline Access: WeFlow's dependency on an internet connection could be a drawback for users who need to access their tasks and workflows while offline. A more robust offline mode or synchronization functionality could be beneficial for those working in environments with intermittent internet connectivity.
Integration Depth: While WeFlow boasts integrations with several popular apps and services, some users might find that certain integrations lack depth or customization options. Improving the depth and flexibility of integrations could make the platform even more versatile for a broader range of users.
Customer Support: While WeFlow offers customer support, some users have reported mixed experiences with response times and issue resolution. Enhancing the responsiveness and effectiveness of customer support could lead to a more positive overall user experience. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x:
Task and Pipeline Management: Sales managers often have to juggle multiple leads, deals, and tasks simultaneously. WeFlow's task management and pipeline tracking features help sales managers organize and prioritize their workload. This ensures that no opportunities fall through the cracks, leading to improved sales conversion rates and revenue.
Collaboration and Communication: Sales is a collaborative effort involving various team members, from sales representatives to marketing and support. WeFlow's collaboration tools allow sales managers to seamlessly communicate with team members, share updates, assign tasks, and provide real-time feedback. This streamlines the sales process, enhances teamwork, and accelerates deal closures.
Time Management and Productivity: Sales managers often face time constraints and the pressure to meet targets. WeFlow's time management features, including task prioritization, scheduling, and productivity insights, help sales managers allocate their time effectively. This results in improved productivity, better use of resources, and the ability to focus on high-impact activities.
Analytics and Reporting: WeFlow's analytics capabilities offer sales managers valuable insights into their team's performance, deal progression, and individual contributions. This data-driven approach allows sales managers to identify strengths, weaknesses, and bottlenecks in the sales process. By leveraging these insights, sales managers can make informed decisions to optimize sales strategies and drive revenue growth.
Workflow Customization: Every sales team operates differently, and customization is crucial. WeFlow's ability to tailor workflows and processes to the specific needs of a sales team is highly beneficial. Sales managers can configure WeFlow to mirror their unique sales process, ensuring that the platform aligns seamlessly with their team's workflow Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

name: Andrea M.
title: "The best UX experience with the power of Salesforce!"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
As an account manager, I've found that Weflow's Salesforce command centre has been a game changer for me. What I like best is how easy it is to look at my contacts and manage my follow-ups.

Before using Weflow, I was constantly clicking around Salesforce, trying to find the information I needed. It was time-consuming and often frustrating. But with Weflow, everything is laid out clearly and concisely, making it easy to stay on top of my accounts.

One example that comes to mind is when I had a call scheduled with a key account, but I had forgotten to prepare for it. With Weflow, I quickly reviewed my notes and past interactions with the account, as Weflow has a better overview layout, so I felt more prepared for the call. Everything went so smoothly and I felt more confident in my ability to manage the account.

Overall, I highly recommend Weflow to anyone who needs to manage their Salesforce pipeline, notes, and tasks. It's made my job as an account manager much easier and less cluttered. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
While I generally find Weflow to be a very useful tool for managing my Salesforce tasks, notes, and pipeline, there are a few things that I think could be improved. For example, I have noticed that some of the features can be a bit buggy at times, which can be frustrating when I am trying to get work done quickly. Additionally, while the task manager is helpful, I sometimes wish there were more batch edit features so that I could update multiple tasks at once.

One other feature that I would really appreciate is one-click telephony out of the box. As an account manager, I often need to call my contacts, and having a built-in telephony feature would be incredibly convenient. At the moment, I have to juggle around between Weflow and Salesforce to make calls, which can slow me down. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x:
As an account manager, one of my biggest challenges is keeping track of all my contacts and managing follow-ups efficiently. Weflow has been a game changer in solving this problem for me. With its powerful command center, I can easily view my pipeline, create notes, manage tasks, and add new records - all synced with Salesforce in real time.

The time-saving benefits of using Weflow are immense. I no longer have to spend hours updating Salesforce manually. Instead, I can easily log emails from Google Workspace/Gmail to Salesforce, use templates to qualify deals, structure meetings, and streamline data capture. Plus, with the ability to make Salesforce updates while writing notes, I can focus on my work without having to switch back and forth between different applications.

Overall, Weflow's ability to simplify Salesforce management has significantly benefited me as an account manager. It allows me to be more productive, efficient, and, ultimately, more successful in my role. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

name: Harry W.
title: "Fantastic Coaching-First application for conversational intelligence"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
I've been using Jiminny for a few months now, and we've been really impressed with the results. Jiminny has helped me identify areas where our sales team can improve, such as their use of key messaging, playbooks, and their handling of objections. It's also helped me craft better messaging for my team.

One of the things we've found most useful is that it allows me to support my sales team even if they're in different time zones. I can listen to calls at my convenience and provide feedback as needed. This has been especially helpful when we've had to step in to support a deal, as we can quickly and easily get up to speed on what's happened so far. The short transcript summaries, integrated into Salesforce, have leveled up our data quality, and context switching when understanding deals. 

Our sales teams loved the sidekick, and it's meant that every deal now has detailed notes, so I no longer need to follow up the team on keeping Salesforce updated. 

Overall, I'm really happy with Jiminny. It's a powerful tool that has helped me improve my sales team's performance. If you're a marketer looking for a way to support your sales team, I highly recommend giving Jiminny a try over some of the more expensive alternatives in Market. They platform did everything we needed, and their differentiators added more value than the other options. 

The team were fantastic all the way through our trial, and gave us the confidence we needed to know that Jiminny was a great fit. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X: Conversation transcription on calls with poor connections are sometimes mis-attributed to the wrong speaker, mostly because of the call platform not keeping up with multiple speakers at the same time. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x:
Managing teams across timezones is hard, and we found that time was being spent sitting on calls together, instead of reviewing deals. Now we can add call reviews to the deal review process, and implement coaching on the spot. It makes the team more efficient and they can spend more time selling. 

Getting salespeople to keep the CRM up to date is always a challenge, and the automated transcription summaries, time-stamped notes in Sidekick and salesforce integration made this much easier. The sales team now love using the platform and my data is better. 

As a marketer, getting access to sales insights is one of the hardest parts of my job, because the teams can't aggregate insights from every call. Between the keyword tracking in the platform and the ability to tag, comment and coach asynchronously, I'm, now able to capture customer sentiment, feedback and quotes, without fighting to get time from my salespeople. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

what_do_you_like_best_about_X:

My biggest gripe with GA4 is that while I was absolutely pumped about it, it just doesn't live up to the hype. It is incredibly hard to use. I barely log into it at the moment because I'm using Dreamdata 

2. I can track in app data and work out what is working and what's not 

One of the things I was really excited about with GA4 is being able to track post-signup activity on a subdomain but it turned out to be a pain to do this

Because Dreamdata has integrations with Segment and with GTM, I can just send data directly from those integrations to Dreamdata and build attribution reports around: 

- What caused the initial signup 
- What influenced someone to go from free trial to revenue
- What my highest ACV accounts needed and then use that data to calculate ROI 

They even show me a breakdown of TOFU, MOFU and BOFU activity and report based on that 

3. This is a product made for B2B SaaS analytics and attribution

Most of the analytics products that are out there serve multiple markets. GA4 is made for e-commerce and for mobile apps predominantly but can do some of what SaaS products need

But Dreamdata is focused only on B2B SaaS and is, quite literally, a dream to configure because of that 

In a sales-led model, you can integrate your CRM data directly and breakdown revenue attribution by deal stage â€“ this is a game changer

what_promblems_solving_x:
Forwrd has been addressing some crucial aspects of our revenue operations and go-to-market strategy since we started using it a few months ago. We're beginning to see the benefits in the following areas:

Prioritizing leads and accounts: Forwrd's AI-powered predictive models are helping us identify and focus on high-impact leads, accounts, and customers. As a result, our sales and marketing teams can allocate their time and resources more effectively.

Streamlining lead qualification: We've started to notice a decrease in lead qualification time, thanks to Forwrd's predictive lead scoring. Our sales development representatives (SDRs) can now engage with more prospects in a shorter amount of time.

Enhancing customer retention: Although we're still exploring this aspect, Forwrd seems to provide valuable insights into customer behavior and factors that contribute to churn. We're optimistic that this will help us improve our retention efforts and keep our customers more satisfied in the long run.

Overall, we're excited to continue discovering the full potential of Forwrd's AI-driven capabilities as we become more familiar with the platform. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

name: Jeff K.
title: "With Syncari, you are building a better data model on the best available data platform,"
what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
Imagine a data orchestration platform the can sync Salesforce, Marketo, Hubspot, Snowflake, Pendo.io, Atlassian Jira, Google Sheets, Zendesk and many other platforms. With syncing running every minute... you don't have to imagine, it's available today with Syncari.

If I was building a new SaaS business today, and started thinking about what the martech stack would look likeâ€¦ before buying a CRM, MAP, DW. I would start with the data model first, rather than years down the road as most SaaS companies do. Then I would research an iPaaS type platform as the base and build up from there. Thereâ€™s a world of them out there too. My preference is one that is thinking 360view first. Extra points for building a place to centralize all your relevant prospect, customer and product data too with self service â€” without having to pay for additional licenses just for report viewing.

Down the road as your business grows and you need to migrate to a larger or different CRM, MAP etcâ€¦ then your migration can occur in weeks instead of months or years. Looking to be acquired, or acquire other businesses? You can easily sync their CRM, MAP, DW and again, migrate their data into your unified platform relatively easily. Or vice versa!

As I mentioned above, even better is a platform that easily connects into most BI tools or has BI built-in.

Experienced data folks know the above is MDM. They all dread MDM when it comes in after the fact, often rightly so. However, the last few years weâ€™ve seen a renaissance of MDM, simply because itâ€™s finally being done right. Finally leveraging no-code functionality to support the business user.

Marketing operations teams are now being tasked with, or driving the projects themselves - to do MDM right.

Without MDM you get a mishmash of siloed operational flows being built by different teams across your individual platforms. Think about your stack today. Youâ€™ve got in-app analytics, map, crm, content attribution touchpoints, web analytics, prospect email cadences, customer email cadences, operational emails, enrichment and intent data. In many cases these arenâ€™t connected.

If you could offload all your operational flows into a single platform instead of many, then have that data synced back across all your departmental platformsâ€¦ that would be transformational! Even better, it's available today with Syncari. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X:
With all that potential in a platform, it does come with a steep learning curve and takes time to show value. It's a no-code data orchestration platform, but it does require you to understand your data model. You can't jump right in, start connecting systems and pull all your data into there to transform and sync across systems. Well, actually â€“ you can. And that's a problem. It's really easy to connect everything, pull data in, then you have a lot of choice of what you can do. 

You can't forget that a platform like this requires you to think differently about your data. Sure, you can use it just like any other integration platform and connect a few systems and be done with it. But the potential with it, is to go beyond just what your data warehouse and etl tools offer. 

Syncari puts the data in the hands of the business user and often, business users don't have the background to build out data projects. That kind of planning, onboarding and implementation requires some serious hand holding. For organizations that have data science teams entrenched in their processes, rolling out Syncari is going to require change management along with project management. However, for companies starting out, it's a great opportunity. They can build their data model and reporting right away inside of Syncari and not be faced with cultural or technical debt that legacy teams may face. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x: Iâ€™m seeing a lot of discussion around indentityresolution at the datawarehouse level. Essentially creating the mythical 360 view of the customer. Except this isnâ€™t a new thing. Syncari has been doing this for the last few years. Skip the headaches and costs of managing a data warehouse and connect your product data to Syncari or use the native Pendo.io integration (synapse). Beyond this, we have projects in the works to sync Zendesk, JIRA, our ERP, our CRM, our MAP and raw data imports directly into Syncari. Eventually we'll phase out the pervious reporting view platform and leverage the BI reporting in Syncari that's built on our synced and unified data. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
headerline: "With Syncari, you are building a better data model on the best available data platform,"

what_do_you_like_best_about_X: Syncari allows us to connect disparate systems across the Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and Operations Tech Stacks. We use Syncari like a Unified Data Platform (UDP) to be our tool to connect data across our enterprise systems. name: Adam H.

what_do_you_like_best_about_X:
We were looking to solve two primary unmet needs for accurately measuring customer health: customer engagement and sentiment; and stakeholder multi-threading. After reviewing many end-to-end and point solutions, Staircase stood out as the best choice for our team to best serve our customers due to its superior AI signal detection.

Staircase has also proven to be the lightest-lift enterprise product I have seen and used, and when they say "integrations in minutes," it's a stunningly accurate claim. Integrations with every tool in our stack, including CRM, collaboration platform, and call transcription, literally required zero IT support. The time to "first value" was fast in our initial pilot, giving us the confidence to do a broader rollout.

Their pricing model also scales well for our company, and there's a strong network effect at play as the more users join the platform, the more accurate customer health becomes. We also wanted to democratize access to customer insights for anyone in our organization without license barriers. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_do_you_dislike_best_about_X: Our primary objective was to look for a CS enrichment tool to complement our existing tools and workflows and Staircase fits this need. While some companies may want a  solution that CSMs and others who support customers work out of every day, our approach was to enrich the experience using tools already well adopted to limit change management friction and potential new tool adoption issues I've experienced in the past. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
what_promblems_solving_x:
